result.execSummary:
The defendant Dale E. LANE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc., a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Seventy-seven (77) days credit is only to be applied if the defendant's probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.
Undergo a psychological evaluation and follow through with all recommendations.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for lawfully prescribed medications which are taken in prescribed doses.

Provide DNA sample.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale E. LANE

records.addlTxt: Indicating 77 days credit if revoked.

Order to Correct Judgment of Conviction.
It is hereby ordered that:
1) the defendant is granted seventy-five (75) days of sentence credit in this case, in addition to the two (2) days sentence credit for the dismissed and read in case no: 15 CM 168 for a total of seventy-seven (77) days sentence credit.
2) The Clerk of Courts is hereby directed to prepare an Amended Judgment of Conviction for 15 CF 146 to reflect the total of seventy-seven (77) days sentence credit, and shall note in the comments section that this credit is only to be applied if the defendant is revoked from probation.
Cover letter.
Letter to Attorney Donarski from MRR.
Letter from MRR to ADA Griesbach.

Defendant's Motion to Correct Judgment of Conviction.
Cover letter.
Indicating two (2) days of sentence credit if defendant's probation is revoked.

Order for Sentence Credit.
It is hereby ordered that:
1) the defendant is granted two (2) days of sentence credit on 15 CM 112.  The Clerk of Courts is hereby directed to prepare an Amended Judgment of Conviction to reflect the sentence credit, and shall note in the comments section that this credit is only to be applied if the defendant is revoked from probation;
2) the defendant is granted two (2) days of sentene credit for the dismissed and read in case no: 15 CM 168.  The Clerk of Court is hereby directed to prepare an amended judgment of conviction for 15 CF 146 to reflect the sentence credit for this dismissed but read in case, and shall note in the comments section that this credit is only applied if the defendant is revoked from probation.
Cover letter.
Letter from MRR to Attorney William Donarski.
to Attorney Griesbach from MRR, re:  sentence credit.

records.addlTxt: Order Permitting Defendant to Withdraw Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect Plea.

Pretrial conference is set for 06-30-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 07-10-15 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant in custody.
The defendant wishes to withdraw his plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  The defendant accepts the findings of L.W. Cole.
Based on the report and the colloquy with the defendant, the court finds that the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently given up his right to raise a not guilty by reason of mental disease of defect defense in this case.
Court will draft the order.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Testimony presented.
The parties argue.
The Court finds that the $2,000.00 cash bail is necessary and appropriate and denies the motion.
State to draft order.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-13-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Minutes.
RE:  Billie Jo Bell, on 03-30-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of intimidate victim.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-06-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Billie Jo Bell and Donna Spaeth or their addresses of 1113 School Street, Two Rivers, WI and 2318 9th Street, Two Rivers, WI.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
